intro: Pteranthus echinatus, commonly known as the spiked pteranthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit and small, fleshy leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a distinctive, spiky appearance. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions.
